instance.context:
having the physical
appearance of death ;

an
appearance carried_out personally in someone else's physical presence ;

Rev looked up and saw her . Lolotte looked up and stiffened . George did n't look up at_all . There was no way to know , no way to guess whether any one of them was surprised at Sarah 's
appearance , believing her to be drugged and senseless - and just possibly dead . Rev said , `` Come in , Sarah . Reckon you know the news '' . And what news , Sarah thought as satirically as Maude might have said it .

the rookie made a brief
appearance in the first period ;

it was Bernhardt's last
appearance in America ;

the
appearance of symptoms that signal the impending loss of the products of conception ;

they try to keep up
appearances ;

ordinary clothing suitable for public
appearances ( as opposed to costumes or sports apparel or work_clothes etc. ) ;

the right of a defendant to have a court use its subpoena power to compel the
appearance of material_witnesses before the court ;

I tried to describe his
appearance to the police ;

an
appearance by actors or performers at the end of the concert or play in order to acknowledge the applause of the audience ;

English actor of Shakespearean roles who was also noted for
appearances in films ;

United_States ballerina who promoted American ballet through tours and television
appearances ;

United_States actress ( born in England ) who made many stage
appearances , often with her husband Hume_Cronyn ;
